image_intro_alt: Monument at the site of the Battle of Prestonpans
description: A list of historic battlefields in Scotland is maintained by Historic Environment Scotland, a Scottish Government agency. Most are marked with monuments and information boards.
title: Campaigns
description: The campaigns were periods in Scottish history when the national interests were threatened by internal or external political events.

The Wars of Scottish Independence were a series of military campaigns in the late 13th and 14th centuries to protect the independence and sovereignty of the Kingdom of Scotland which had been threatened by the Kingdom of England.
The Jacobite risings were a series of attempts to restore the House of Stuart to the thrones of England and Scotland. They took place in 1689, 1715, 1719 and 1745.

The Jacobite rising of 1689, March 1689 to February 1692, took place primarily in the Scottish Highlands. Its purpose was to restore James II & VII to the throne, following his deposition by the November 1688 Glorious Revolution.

The Jacobite rising of 1745 was an attempt by Charles Edward Stuart to regain the British throne for his father, James Francis Edward Stuart. It took place during the War of the Austrian Succession, when the bulk of the British Army was fighting in mainland Europe, and proved to be the last in a series of revolts that began in March 1689, with major outbreaks in 1715 and 1719.
title: Date of Engagement
description: The date on which the battle took place.
title: Location
description: The latitude and longitude of the battle site.
title: Battles
Battlefields
Council Area
description: This is a parent for the 32 Council areas of Scotland. Each individual council area tag would allow selection of battle sites in that area.

title: Aberdeenshire
description: Aberdeenshire lies in the north-east of Scotland. It has 4 battle sites (1 Clan battle site).
title: East Lothian
description: East Lothian lies in the south-east of Scotland. It has 4 battle sites.
title: Falkirk
description: Falkirk lies in central Scotland. It has 2 battle sites.
title: Midlothian
description: Midlothian lies in the east central area of Scotland. It has 2 battle sites.
title: Stirling
description: Stirling lies in the central Scotland. It has 4 battle sites.
title: Outcome
description: This is a parent for the battle result.
